info.headline: Frost Advisory issued January 02 at 3:25AM PST until January 02 at 8:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...A Frost Advisory is in effect through early this morning. A Freeze Warning is in effect for late tonight until mid morning Monday. * WHERE...Coachella Valley and San Diego County Deserts. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM PST Monday. For the Frost Advisory, until 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Through early this morning, temperatures of 33 to 36 degrees are expected, possibly dropping as low as 28 to 32 degrees in a few wind-sheltered locations. For tonight through mid morning Monday, temperatures are expected to bottom out between 27 and 32 degrees in most areas, but may remain in the mid 30s near the larger cities.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing
